Key Match Events: Jackson Jobe made his MLB debut as a closer against the Tampa Bay Rays, throwing a scoreless ninth inning in a 7-1 win.
Jobe retired three of the four batters he faced, throwing seven of nine pitches for strikes and generating one whiff on seven swings.
Jobe's fastball averaged 98 mph during his debut.
Post-Match Reflections: Jackson Jobe expressed his happiness and surprise at being called up for his MLB debut, stating it was a special moment.
Jobe mentioned that he felt more nervous warming up in the bullpen than pitching in the game.
Jobe appreciated the fans' support and chanting during his debut.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jackson Jobe was called up from the minor leagues to join the Detroit Tigers' bullpen for the rest of the 2024 season, including the postseason.
Jobe is expected to be in the Opening Day starting rotation in 2025.
Jobe's journey to the MLB included a hype video played on the scoreboard detailing his progress through high school and the minor leagues.
